program: Sastera Sains Sosial (Social Sciences and Humanities)
subject: Literature

overview.description: Comprehensive literature curriculum exploring Malaysian and world literature, literary analysis, creative writing, and critical interpretation of texts across cultures and time periods

learning_objectives: Understand and appreciate Malaysian and world literary traditions
Develop advanced literary analysis and critical thinking skills
Master creative writing techniques across various genres
Apply literary theory and cultural context to text interpretation
Cultivate aesthetic appreciation and cultural understanding through literature

units.title: Classical and Traditional Malaysian Literature
learning_outcomes: Understand the development of classical Malay literature
Analyze themes and literary devices in traditional texts
Appreciate the cultural and historical context of classical works
Compare traditional and contemporary literary forms

lessons.title: Hikayat and Classical Malay Narratives
objectives: Understand the structure and characteristics of hikayat
Analyze narrative techniques in classical Malay stories
Evaluate the cultural values embedded in traditional narratives

activities.description: Close reading and analysis of Hikayat Hang Tuah excerpts
Map narrative structure and character development
Discuss Malay court culture and value systems
Compare with other Southeast Asian epic traditions

resources: Hikayat Hang Tuah text excerpts and translations
cross_curricular_connections: History: Malay court culture and society
Anthropology: Traditional belief systems and values

lessons.title: Syair and Classical Malay Poetry
objectives: Understand the form and function of syair poetry
Analyze poetic devices and rhythmic patterns
Appreciate the oral tradition and performance aspects

activities.description: Analyze structure and meter in Syair Bidasari
Practice traditional recitation and performance
Compose original syair following traditional patterns
Perform and evaluate peer compositions

units.title: Modern Malaysian Literature and Identity
learning_outcomes: Understand the development of modern Malaysian literature
Analyze themes of identity, nationalism, and social change
Evaluate the influence of historical events on literary production
Compare works across different Malaysian literary traditions

lessons.title: Nationalist Literature and Independence Themes
objectives: Understand the role of literature in the independence movement
Analyze nationalist themes in poetry and prose
Evaluate the relationship between politics and artistic expression

activities.description: Analyze nationalist themes in works by Usman Awang and A. Samad Said
Connect literary works to historical independence events
Prepare debate on literature's role in social movements
Reflect on literature's continuing relevance to national identity

resources: Critical essays on literature and nationalism
cross_curricular_connections: Political Science: Nationalism and identity formation

lessons.title: Contemporary Multicultural Voices
objectives: Understand Malaysia's multicultural literary landscape
Analyze themes of cultural identity and integration
Evaluate different perspectives on Malaysian society

activities.description: Compare works by Malay, Chinese, and Indian Malaysian authors
Explore themes of cultural identity and belonging
Share personal cultural stories and connections
Discuss literature's role in promoting understanding

units.title: World Literature and Comparative Analysis
learning_outcomes: Understand major world literary traditions and movements
Apply comparative literary analysis across cultures
Evaluate universal themes and cultural specificities
Develop global literary perspective and cultural empathy

lessons.title: Postcolonial Literature and Global Perspectives
objectives: Understand postcolonial literary theory and themes
Analyze works from different postcolonial contexts
Evaluate the relationship between literature and power

activities.description: Study key concepts in postcolonial literary theory
Compare postcolonial works from Africa, Asia, and the Caribbean
Discuss representation, voice, and cultural authenticity
Connect themes to contemporary global issues

cross_curricular_connections: Political Science: Power structures and resistance

lessons.title: Universal Themes and Cultural Expressions
objectives: Identify universal themes across different literary traditions
Analyze how culture shapes the expression of universal experiences
Evaluate the balance between universality and cultural specificity

activities.description: Map universal themes like love, death, and justice across cultures
Analyze how different cultures express similar themes
Create multimedia presentation on a universal theme
Appreciate diversity within universal human experience

resources: Global literature selection representing various cultures

units.title: Creative Writing and Literary Production
learning_outcomes: Master various creative writing techniques and genres
Develop personal voice and artistic expression
Apply literary theory to original creative work
Engage in peer review and editorial processes

lessons.title: Poetry Composition and Form Experimentation
objectives: Master traditional and contemporary poetic forms
Develop personal poetic voice and style
Apply various poetic techniques and devices

activities.description: Practice different poetic forms: sonnet, free verse, concrete poetry
Develop personal poetic voice through writing exercises
Apply metaphor, imagery, and rhythm in original compositions
Perform original poetry in class reading session

cross_curricular_connections: Music: Rhythm and sound in poetry
Performing Arts: Poetry performance and spoken word

lessons.title: Short Fiction Writing and Narrative Craft
objectives: Master short story structure and narrative techniques
Develop character and setting effectively
Apply point of view and voice consistently

activities.description: Learn short story structure and plot development
Create compelling characters through writing exercises
Write original short stories applying learned techniques
Participate in structured peer review process

core_experiments: Literary text analysis and close reading techniques
Creative writing workshops and peer review
Research and presentation on literary movements
field_studies: Author interviews and literary figure meetings
Cultural site visits related to literary works
Community storytelling and oral tradition collection

equipment: Recording devices for oral tradition work

cross_curricular_integration.philosophy: Ethical and existential themes in literature
